document.heading: New Washington Convention Center Neighborhood Stability Act of 1998

history.narrative: Law 12-93, the “New Washington Convention Center Neighborhood Stability Act of 1998,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 12-449, which was referred to the Committee of the Whole. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on December 16, 1997, and January 6, 1998, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on January 26, 1998, it was assigned Act No. 12-266 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 12-93 became effective on April 29, 1998.
